'Twas noontide of summer, the meadow ablaze,
A shimmer of gold in the languorous haze.
Cicadas held court in the emerald trees,
While petals were carried on honeyed-sweet breeze.

The river ran lazy, its laughter subdued,
Beneath willow shadows in cool interlude.
The grasses lay flattened by footsteps unknown,
Soft secrets of deer in the daylight alone.

A hush in the brilliance, a pause in the light,
The world held its breath in the heart of the bright.
'Twas noontide of summer—eternity's seam,
Where memory lingers and time halts to dream.

So linger, fair moment, in languor and gleam—
Let the world slow its turning, let all simply dream.
